Key Match Events: Jamal Musiala scored a solo wonder goal as Germany thumped Hungary 5-0.
Niclas Fullkrug, Florian Wirtz, Aleksandar Pavlovic, and Kai Havertz were also on target for Germany.
Germany put Hungary under pressure from the start, with a goal-line clearance by Dominik Szoboszlai and a missed one-on-one chance by Fullkrug.
Fullkrug made amends by scoring the opening goal with a tap-in inside the six-yard box.
Havertz had two chances to double Germany’s lead before the break, hitting the bar and sending a curled effort wide.
Germany added a second goal after an hour when Wirtz found Musiala, who drove from his own half and slotted the ball home.
Musiala set up Wirtz for Germany’s third goal.
Pavlovic added a fourth goal for Germany.
Havertz wrapped up the three points with a penalty.
Post-Match Reflections: Jamal Musiala and Florian Wirtz were praised for their outstanding performances, combining to assist each other and score goals.
Musiala was highlighted as the player of the match, notching his sixth goal for Germany and registering his eighth international assist.
